text: Bottle at In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst. Clear golden with white head. The aroma has notes of kvass, honey, caramel, coke, some fruitiness and tea. Very sweet flavor with notes of kvass, caramel, honey, lemon, a bit acidic, wood. Soft carbonation, medium-bodied.
Bottle at " In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst". Clear amber. Aroma of brown sugar, oak, caramel. Sweetish-tart, bread, caramel, wood. Medium-bodied, low carbonation. Reminded me home made kvass.

Bottle thanks to WingmanWillis. Murky burnt orange colour with a sweet, spicy aroma. Taste is sweet, boozy raisins with a hint of bitterness to finish. Wouldnt be my first choice of beer, but not unpleasant.

Bottle on train. Pours red brown with a thin white head. Aroma is brown sugar, some funk, tart fruits. Taste is sweet, brown sugar, a little orange and then a little funk on the finish before mellowing out. Nice and smooth. Ok
Bottle share thanks to Wingman. Winner style. Poured hazy light brown with small off white head. Nose is sour grapefruit. Taste is sweet grapefruit lemon citrus fruit. Sour tang is there. Nice

Rami Rami is drinking a Faro Girardin 1882 by Brouwerij Girardin at Konstruktorska Business Center

2017 na korku. Siano, troche stajnia, owoce, slodkie, takie az fermentujace, chlebowe nutki, kwasnosc niewysoka. Niespecjalnie mi pasi, acz ciekawe

Appearance: amber, orange, clear, no head. Aroma: apple, mold, metallic. Taste: heavily sour, lightly bitter, medium sweetness. Palate: medium-light body, oily feel, creamy, soft carbonation, light bitter, wormwood-like finish.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 23D, adapted). Bottle 37.5 cl - Batch unknown (BBF unknown). AROMA: moderate sour aroma with notes of horse blanket / goaty. faint apples with a slight sweet background. APPEARANCE: amber color and clear. medium-low ivory head with low retention. TASTE: medium-low sour flavor with a slightly sweet background. faint apples and low wild yeast fermentation (horsy). faint bready-grainy notes. low bitterness with a dry finish. PALATE: light body with medium-low carbonation. slight tartaric mouthfeel. OVERALL: an average faro-style lambic.
Bottle, 375 ml at Gainsbar, Kortrijk. Pours brown small off white head. Malty, brown sugar, light fruit, moderate sweetness, sourish note, some dry bitterness in finish. Not very exciting,

Piwo ma głęboką bursztynową barwę, kolor wpada wręcz w brunatny. Piana jest średnio-intensywna, ale trwała, drobno-pęcherzykowa i kremowa.
Aromat nie zabija mocą, na pierwszym planie są nuty dzikie w stylu siana, stajni i kiszonki. W tle nieco nut słodkich, owocowych. 
W smaku piwo jest słodko-kwaśne, wysoko wysycone. Początkowo wydaje się, że jest standardowo - stajnia, siano, wytrawność i cytrusowy kwasek. Szybko jednak pojawia się słodki posmak cukru kandyzowanego. Finisz jest lekko cierpki, herbaciany.
Bottle. Amber colour with white head. Fruit, barnyard aroma. Sweet, fruit barnyard, caramel and yeast taste. Medium body.
Bottle - Vintage 2015 - Funk and some sweaty notes. Cloudy dark gold with a nice beige head. Light barnyard and sweat with a touch of sweetness and funky finish. Not bad.

0,375l from bottle at home. Vintage 2017. Bordeaux like colour, small pink head. smells musty, tobacco, light fruit notes, some sweetness, nutty, candy, overall ok smell. Medium Body, light carbonation, soft mouthfeel. tastes of candy, tobacco, bit musty, some fruits, some grass. finishes lightly sweet and lightly bitter with some fruit and grass notes. ok, but could use some complexity.

Clear amber ish color with a small layer on top. Good intensity in the aroma. Medium body and a bit soft carbonation level. Ok balance between sweetness and acidity. Quite sherry ish flavor. Fruity, oak, vinous, oxidation and some candy in the flavor.[Bottle from a trade with Grima]

Bottle. Pours a murky brown with a fading light beige bubbly head. Aroma is of apple, vinegar, citrus, cinnamon, clove, caramel, slightly sour. Taste is of apple, caramel, vinegar, bready, citrus, grassy. Light oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation.

37.5 cL bottle. Hazy, orangish-brown color. The aroma is ripe apples, caraway seeds, cinnamon, tart cherries, and leather. Sweet and sugary, with a subdued funk. Light to medium body, sticky, clean, and syrupy. This is a fun and well balanced beer. The funkiness is mellowed out, sadly. Nicely complex, and well made.

Botella @In de Verzekering tegen de Grote Dorst 04/12/16 
Color dorado, sabor dulce, cuerpo medio.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

0.375 l bottle from Dranken Geers, best before end 2017. Clear, dark reddish amber with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, slightly sourish, a bit fruity and minimally funky aroma of lemon, brown sugar, oak, some leather and hints of sweat. Sweetish, slightly sourish, slightly fruity and minimally funky taste of lemon, vinegar, cherries, oak, leather and hints of sweat, followed by a short, slightly tart, a bit woody finish. Medium body, minimally astringent and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, very soft carbonation. Quite nice, still some lambic character left, best Faro Ive had so far I believe.

Unfiltered brown, thin white head. 
Herbal, earthy, tobacco, citrus, 
Slightly sweet, soft carbonation.
10.11.2016 at Koelschip in Copenhagen - Decent sour smell with some sweet notes. Sour mild candy sweet taste with fruits.
Leicht trübes, leicht rötliches Bernstein mit reichlich Schaum. Etwas süßlich, minimal Karamell, fruchtig, Apfel, säuerlich.

Golden honey colour, with a rapidly shrinking white head. Light body with plenty of carbonation. Aroma is mildly acetic over a malt base. Flavour has some sharp sour apple, a touch of caramel, and sugar. For me, the sweetness cancels out the dry finish that would other be there.

Bottled 375ml. -at the MBR Sour Beer tasting. Golden coloured, minimal white head, slightly sugary nose. Uhhhh...Sweet sugary taste with notes of caramel and touch of apples with rather dry finish. A way too sweet; like liquid caramelized apples.

375ml bottle at home. Hazy orange / brown with a small white head. Light to medium body with fizzy carbonation. Subtle sour and sweet tones. Brown sugar, caramel, tart, malts and some apple. Mwah, not too good.
At the MBR Sour Beer Murky amber body. Sweet sugary aroma. Sweet sugary taste, slightly tart, ending dry, a light bitter touch. Not as bad as they go.
Clear amber, offwhite head. Vinous, acetic aroma. Flavour is malty, sweetish, slightly sour and bitter. Hmm.

How: Bottle.
Where: Sweet & Sour 2016.
Appearance: Dark golden colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Sour, tart, a bit sweet.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: A bit sweet, tart, sour, some fruit.
Bottled @ Cambrinus pub Brugge. How a faro should be: sour and sweet, but not too sweet.
A: Light brown/golden coloured with a thin white head. N: Some oak, apple, pear T: Apple, hint of oak. Pilsner. O: Quite sweet and some maltyness to it.

Bottle courtesy of AndySnow. Pours tiny hazy golden with a small frothy offwhite head that leaves some sparse trace on the glass while dissiapting. Smell is tiny malty, tiny sugary, tiny fruity and slightly funky with crackers, burnt sugar, lemon juice, hay, minerals, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is sweet, tiny sour, malty and sugary. Mouthfeel is round, tiny sparkling and medium bodied. Finish is sweet and tiny sour with crackers, burnt sugar, lemon juice, minerals and lemon zest. Bit stale but decent.
Copper liquid with yellowish head. Aroma is sour, appels, berries. Tastes same but less, medium sweet, light bitter, light + sour. Light body.

Aroma: sour; vinegear; cherry
Appearance: amber, clear, minimal head, 
Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, 
Palate: medium body, thin feel, average carbonation, long finish,
Bottle. Pours amber with small white head. Aroma: bread, caramel, brown sugar, weak balsamico. Taste:medium sweet, brown sugary, caramel, berries, malty. Medium body. Sweet finish.

Girardin tasting @Stadin panimobaari. 
Poured deep amber color with a thin white head. 
Woody, sweet ripe fruits in aroma. 
Some funky notes. 
Flavor has sweetness, ripe fruits, more like marmalade, candy. Still no fan of faro. Drinkable yes, but nothing I will try again.

Bottle thanks to Ben!! Closing in on the 10 rates of all styles before the big 10K. Great progress this week. People need to send me Eisbocks and Krystalweiss though. Anyway, this particular sample is a mostly clear reddish hazel, large beige head, slow to dissipate and nice to lace. Aroma has that candi sugar thing going, along with dust, grain and grass. Flavor is mercifully lightly sweet, hints of tartness and funk, candi sugar, caramel, grass, dust. Medium body. This is really not a style I am digging, but damned if I am not going to get 10 rakes.

A 375ml bottle with the numbers 2016 and 09 on different locations on the cork. Havent been able to find a consensus on what this means exactly. Poured into a Lindemans flute glass. It poured a clear copper brown colour with a thin tanned head that kind of sticks around and leaves some nice lacing. Had a hard time trying to describe the aroma, but I would say fruity plum, prunes and apple, light tartness, butterscotch and brown sugar. Tastes of candi sugar, plum and apples. Sweet and lightly tart. Light to medium bodied with light carbonation. Overall this was an ok Faro. Im actually in two minds as to whether I really I enjoyed this though. After going through the whole bottle, Im on the fence.

Bottle at WvdSG. Copper golden with nice slightly off white head. Caramel, cardboard, light spices, raw grains, green leaves and hay. Under medium sweet, light bitter and sour. Medium bodied with slight fizzy carbonation.
pour red brown without a head. light dark fruit aroma, light lemon light sour, light sweet. medium bodied, lively carbonation.

Chilled 37.5 green bottle corked and capped poured into a glass. Translucent dark Amber with medium beige head. Aroma is dark candy sugar, light body, lower carbonation, and good small-bubble lacing. Taste is dark candy sugar and nice tartness. Nice beer.

The beer is a fairly dark amber color. Its somewhat hazy but it just depends on how much sediment kicked up. Large head, slightly off white. Lots of lacing. The aroma is weird. Theres lambic funk to it, but its buried beneath odd and not very pleasant sweet flavors. Theres a vegetal cooked onion note, some plastic and sickly thin caramel. Theres also some metallic tone to it. Its not really offensive but definitely off when taken together. Taste has moderate to medium sweetness. Its thin, very light caramel. Some sour citrus tang, but its well behind the sugar. Some body to it. A bit slick and sticky in the finish. Not my cup of tea.

Clear, dark amber color with a bit of tan head. Aroma is mainly malty with a touch of caramel, ginger, pepper and some other spices. Taste starts with just a hair of tartness and continues malty with moderate sweetness. Finish has bread crust flavor, a bit of caramel and also a bit of bitterness. Body is light with medium carbonation. Overall its quite nice table beer, tasty and easy to drink but a bit simple.
37cl bottle. Clear copper with an almost non-existent white head. Caramel, honey, some very subtle funk notes, sour grapes and vinegar, and a medicinal/metallic bitterness.

Copper body, nice head. Sweet cake malts, caramel, berries. Soft sour sweet balance, drinkable actually, accessible. Quite woody. Ends sweeter again. One of if not the best faro Ive had this far, but well that doesnt really says much... (375ml bottle from Dekoninck)
Bottle shared thanks to Richthevillan, cheers rich. Dark Amber beer. Aroma has a faint sweetness, otherwise muted. Taste toffee, some sugar and malts. Disappointing.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle thanks to rich the villan. Brown good head. Aroma is sweet sugary fruits taste same bit of a bad aftertaste very thin flat. Ok at best.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear amber pour with a thin beige head, sweet sugar aroma, taste has some red fruits, sweet action, candied fruit, not much lambic action.
backlog from bottle. deep golden to more amber colour with an eggshell head on top. nose of sweet brown candy sugar, slight funk, slight funk, sweet apples. earth, caramel. not a fan
Cloudy brown, no head. Aroma of cane sugar. Tastes like grape soda, with hints of lemon on the end. Very sweet without being sticky.
Pours hazy, orangish amber. Not much head. Strong brown sugar aroma, with hint of orange. Flavor is reminiscent of cotton candy, and a bit sour. Full body, mineral finish.

New Years beer, first of 2016! Pouring a deep amber with a beige head of foam the aroma is tart, acidic but with soft sweet sugary marshmallowish notes. Medium to full mouthfeel but with a light dry finish. The taste is oaky, tart, candy sweet tarts with some malty caramel and lemon drops. Best bottled Faro Ive had but to appreciate this style you need to have it fresh on draft.

Tra il dorato carico e l'ambrato, riflessi dorati, leggermente velata, schiuma bianca non molto persistente.
Aroma di leggero stallatico, polvere, uva bianca, leggermente lattica ed acidula.
Al palato inizialmente leggero stallatico, uva bianca ed acidula, successivamente leggermente astringente con un amaro di frumento misto ad erbaceo e note legnose.
Corpo leggero, carbonazione medio-bassa, leggermente oleosa; non molto dolce per essere un Faro, abbastanza equilibrata con una propensione verso l'amaro.
Bottle. Hazy red color, nice white head. head. Aroma is candy sugar, light funk. Taste is light sour, light dry and at finish light candy sweetness. Flavor is herbal and candy, some wine notes.
Aroma of fruits, sweet brown sugar and sour. Red-brown color, clear, white head. Medium sweetness and a light-medium sourness. Flat carbonation, medium body. Overall a good lambic style faro.
Bij Lion op pokeravond. Wat een ellende droog slap en zonder Body te zoet en wrang. Bar

On bottle from Drankenzentrale du Hopduvel in Gent. Dark golden color, good foam. Medium aroma intensity; some stable, "champagne soda" and citrus and some burnt sugar. Medium body & complexity. Some sweetness, balances quite well. Enjoyable

37,5cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian - thanks! Pours slightly hazy amber with an off-white head. Mild, funky aroma with barnyard, earthy notes and caramel. Medium to moderate sweet, surprisingly balanced with a nice acididty. Funky and refreshing.

hazy darm mber colour, moderate sized yellowish head; aroma of fruits, some balsamic acid, woody notes,and biscuit; taste is fully dominated by added sugar with some bitterness and without any sourness; not really good...
Gravity at the hanging bat. Pours deep amber, nose is funky, fruity, toffee, taste is sweet, sugary, light funk.

Bottle at home. Aroma of sweet candy sugar, malt, caramel. Flavour is sweet with a hint of sourness. Body is medium. Girardin make one of the best Gueuzes in the world, but even they cant make a worthwhile Faro. Guess I just dont like the style.

Bottle. Pours dark amber with beige head. The head stays for some moments. Aroma is fruits, sourness, grapes, sweetness. Flavor is sweet, caramel, bitter, fruits, grapes. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: good.

Slightly hazy copper beer. Retentive tan head. Nose is oak, acidity, fruity notes, mild yeasty funk. Flavor is crisper than the nose would suggest, less acidity, malty notes, hops and mild yeast in the finish. Lingering fruity acidity. Pretty nice.

Flasche (375 ml), wohl von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin-Wedding. - Rotbraun, trüb; reichlich sahniger beigefarbener Schaum. - Nase herb-muffig-säuerlich wie ein echtes Lambic, nur etwas milder, im Hintergrund schwache Karamelsüße. - Antrunk mild säuerlich und schwach kellerig-herb. Die Lambic-Aromen sind eher dezent; muffige Herbe und Säure reiben sich mit mild süßlichem Karamelmalz und Apfelschale. Perlend rezent, weich im Mund. Im Abgang klaffen die beiden Seiten dieses Bieres am deutlichsten auseinander, mit unrunden, süßsäuerlichen, etwas abgestandenen Aromen. - Interessante Erfahrung, diese gesüßte Lambic-Variante. Muß ich trotzdem kein zweites Mal trinken.
Un faro à la belle robe rousse, belle mousse. Nez assez marqué par le lambic sur un fond de caramel. Bouche tout en tension, une belle acidité et une longue finale acidulée.

375 ml bottle. The beer is a hazed ruby color with a white head of foam. Good retention. The wroma has dark fruits, sour berry, musty straw, and more of a mild sweetness. The raste is predominantly sour, and is actually enjoyable. Medium body and higher cadbonation. One of the better faros i have tried.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye..Pour is ruby with a fading bubbles..Nose is sweet plum, spice, caramel, fig....Taste is oak, spice, earth, sweetness, light chocolate, dates..

Amber clear with medium off-white head. Mld sour aroma. Soft sweetsaour fruity taste, well abalnced sweetness, not too much, followed by medium strong grapefruit-type bitterness. The latter remains in the aftertaste with some fruity notes.
* Leckeres, dunkles Bier. Leichte Säure mit einer angenehmen caramelligen Süße. Sehr süffiger Körper, frisch und rund. Lecker aber vielleicht ein Hauch zu viel Kandis.

Bottle; pours a caramel brown with a white head; sweet aroma of caramel, honey, sugar, and some vanilla and fruit hints; taste is sweet with caramel, sugar, honey, and vanilla; finish is more sweet than bitter; was not sure what to expect with my first Faro but this was pretty good

Clear brown colour with small off-white head. Sour fruity aroma with some sweetness and hints of mint (?). Flavour is mild sourness and some sugar sweetness. Slowly sourness is overruled by sugar. Short aftertaste.z
Hazy amber colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of oak, fruit, acid and funk. Very thin.
Bottle 0.375l at home, Nivala. Colour is cloudy orange with small thick white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, berries, sweetness, caramel and some sourness.
Bottle @home. Brown orange color with a off-white head. Smells and tastes sweet, bit sour, fruity, citrus, orange, caramel.

Bottle @ home. Hazy amber colour with a small off-white to beige head that doesnt last too long. Smells sourish, slightly trash, slightly sweaty. Tastes sweet and sour, slightly fruity, slightly sugar. Very easy to drink, soft carbo, thin to medium body.

bag-in-a-box @ Tuulensuu
Copper reddish brown clear beer with almost no head. Aroma has syrupy sweetness, lemon and barnyard. Flavor is caramelly sweet and lemony sour. Palate is thin and flat. Mild bitterness. Aftertaste is sour with some grapefruit and sweetness. A lot like still coca-cola with lemon juice. Not enjoyable.

Bottle. Semi hazy amber beer with a small white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of citrus, peaches, oranges and yeast. Flavor is fruity with notes of caramel, citrus, peaches, tea and grass. Well balanced.
Bottle. Hazy reddish brown color with a thin head. Mild aroma of apricot and honey. Sweet taste with some initial sourness. Medium thin body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tijdens het gourmet, niets opgeschreven, prima combo met het eten. Amber/bruin witte kraag. Aroma beperkte zuren, fruitig. Goede smaken, wat zoetig, licht zuurtje, glad matige body maar zoals ik al zei gewoon goed icm met het vlees. Prima 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

duft: æble sur svag røg agtig. rosin tobal grøn duft.
samg: æble tør ikke som sådan sur. meget sød øl rigtig fin duft men ikke så god i smagen desværre

Bottle from Etre Gourmet cons 2015-03-14 Duved
AR: sour, grape skin, citrus
AP: amber, high frothy study ofwhite head, nice lacings
F: sour, caramel, grape skins, citrus, wee bubbly carbonation, sugary feeling

March 13, 2015. Bottle at home, cork marked 2014. 
Clear dark amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is dark sugars, some caramel, apples, light funk. Taste is light sweet, less sweet than expected, finish is light dry with tart apples and metallic notes. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

375ml bottle from Mikkeller webshop. Deep amber colour, off white foam head and aroma of malt, sugar, citric, barnyard. Flavour is sweet malt, sugary, with some sour and funk, plus fruity notes. Medium bodied, medium carbonation, lingering sour & sweet in the finish. Quite OK.

37 cl bottle at home. Pours a clear amber-brown colour with a tight white head. Slight musty aroma, more of sweet malt. Taste is slight sweetness, then the mushroom sourness associated with Girardin. Lively on the tongue, there is some of the sourness of a gueuze, but it is tempered with a taste I can only liken to a flat cola. It has also has some peppery, leafy hop taste which is rather good. Overall, quite interesting. Glad I tried it.
Pours copper with white head. Aroma is fruit and straw. Flavour is fruity, sweet, vinous and spices.

Dunkel orangegoldene Farbe, fingerbreite leicht beige Schaumkrone. Geruch fruchtig, vergorenes Obst, etwas trocken. Geschmack ziemlich süß, Honig, reife Früchte, Karamell, leichte Würze, insgesamt überwiegt aber die Süße, interssant!
Hazy and dark orange in colour. This beer smells like it's going to be crazy sweet but has a nice mild taste.

3.75L bottle from Belgian eshop

Pours dark orange-red, slightly hazy with small head. Aroma of sweet malts and candy sugar. Some sour and funky notes in the background. Ballanced taste, acidity ballances the sweet taste, but finishes on the sweet side. Some dry fruits and dark malts in the taste. 
Nice brew!

Old rating rerated 01.12.2014, 0,375l bottle sampled @ UNA sour beer tasting:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is very mild sour-ish grassy, stable, hay, wet grass, sugar, shed, oak, wet grain, sorrel. Taste is watery, hay, wet grass, minerals, weeds, sugar, wet grain, flowers. Little bitterness, watery mouthfeel. Boring.

Very dark brown with plum accents. 3 finger head. 375 new bottles in gueuze tumbler. Nose is sugary sweet with a lot tannic lemon hint. Very tart with nice balance. Love the sweetness bird a pretty darn good faro. Not hard to get so Im glad I finally got to rate this one.

Dark orange color with hardly any head. Very sweet aroma of candis sugar and malts. The same taste that reflects the candis sugar. Quite easy to drink, its just that the sugar overpowers the lambic character way too much and its not really sour.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2014 Bottle @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a clear red colour, small white head. Aroma is softly malty, notes of fruit (plums, grapes, little strawberry). Taste is medium to heavy sweet, softly bitter, softly sour, nice! Little to medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

Artificial faro with yellowish white, thick moussy but not very stable head and darkish, copper-like amber colour, clear. Artificial sweetness in the nose, caramel, subdued lambic funkiness, tea, honey, dried leaves, sweet tobacco. Taste begins fresh and crisp, sweet caramel candy along with a lemony sourness, bit artificial, lambic coming through quite late and in a shy way, in the form of a light funky sourness and bitterishness. A bit more lambic-like than its congeners by Lindemans and Timmermans but from this brewery I had expected something more earthy and funky.
37,5cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Brown color. Thin head. Medium sweetness, medium sourness. Banana, brett, caramel, grape.
ticking a faro, in a lambic basket in amsterdam. Usually giradins are very tart and the late additional sweetness really balanced this out, very nice and much more drinkable than regular giradin
Pours deep cloudy amber with low off-white head. Aroma of sweet fruit, light bretta, apples, light grapes. Taste is funky sweet, light apples and hay. Body is smooth with soft carbonation.

Pours caramel brown with a low white head. Aromas of raspberry, vanilla, cherries, slight funk, hay. Taste is raspberries, vanilla, oak chips, cherries, vanilla. Mouthfeel is smooth and tart with medium carbonation.

Botle. Red amber with small white head. Aroma sour with malty notes. In taste sourness with soy sauce, very bad. Low bitterness, medium body, high, lively carbonation. Maybe its a good beer but definitely not my bottle.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Copper color with off-white head. Soft sour fruit aroma. Taste of fruit, some acidity and wood
A very nice lambic faro, balanced very well between the sugar and the sour/tart notes. good job!

Coppery color with a frothy and dense light beige head, with good lasting. Aroma has notes of red fruits, some vinegar notes. Flavor is fruity, dominating cherries and berries, wooden and slightly acidic in the mouth. The final is fruity with very light vinegar hints.

Pours red amber with low ofx white head
Aromas of cherries, oak, malt syrup, hints of bicarbonate
Taste has cherries, hints of liqourise, caramel, sour fruits, red berries
Wee bit light bodied with medium too high carbonation
Color caoba limpio con espuma blanca ligera. Aromas de melaza, caña de azúcar y membrillo. En boca es ligera, dulce y afrutada de inicio, con acidez leve y final seco. Rica.
375ml bottle. Pours dark orange brown with a small head. Aroma is sour bacon and sweet banana. Taste is sweet candy to start. Sour, smoky finish.

Bottle (375 ml). Clear golden amber with a small off-white head and some lacing. Aroma is of brown sugar, light barnyard, green apple and light tropical fruits. Taste is moderately sweet with brown sugar, light barnyard (lighter than aroma), green apple and light medicinal finish. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Its not bad for a Faro, but its not good for a beer. Decent balance. I have not been impressed by Girardin outside from their awesome Black Label and Fond Gueuze Bierpallieter.
Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Clear deep golden color, big white head. Nice sour aroma, apples, fruits, earth. Balanced taste, sour and sweet, caramel, some citrus notes.
Bottle purchased at Kris Wines, London. Sweet and sour at the same time. Easy drinking. I like.

Dark copper pour, with a small white head. A soightly funk barnyard aroma, with some minerals and quite a bit of sweetness. There are touches of stone fruits, and the funk is quite dialed back, which i expected for the style. I can see how this is much more approachable to lambic beginners.
37,5 cl. bottle. Hazy amber colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of oak, fruit, acid and sourness.
Flaske, smagt hos Lars, smager godt, er jo tilsat sukker, spontan gæret i åbne kar, er ikke min ynglings stil, smager godt, er syrlig.
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2014 Flaska från belgianbeerz.com. Kopparfärgad vätska med gräddigt skum. Dofter av säd och hö. Låg sötma med liten syrlighet. Tunn munkänsla. Inte särskilt upphetsande.

37,5cl bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear dark blond beer, nice stable off white head.
NOSE: sweet, wood, lactic, brett, fruity, caramel.
TASTE: syrupy, sweet, chemical, apples.
Just bad for Girardin standards
Backlog. Bottle at a Systembolaget arranged tasting. Raisins and dark bread with some caramel.
Bottle from a friend, many thanks. Hazy brown color with minimal white head. Aroma of Tokai wine, raisins, malt, wood. Taste, semi sweet, semi tart, again Tokai wine, raisins, sugar.

Poured from bottle. Light brown color, hazy with small white head. Pleasant vinous sourness in aroma (tokai). Pleasant sourness also in taste. Caramel, raisins in taste. Medium body with medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, courtesy of Cuso. Style #72. Pours amber color, lightly beige head. Aroma is sourish, very fruity, port wine. Taste is sourish, red fruits, lemon, lightly sweet.

Bottle at home. Fairly underwhelming but ok. Little on the sweet side and very thin in the mouth. Long dryish finish with apples, grapes, little funk. Easy drinker and enjoyable but my least fav Girardin.

375 ml bottle courtesy of Gabriel, Thanks. Pours a hazy brown color with a small white head that has fair retention. The aroma is sour-bitter with apples, pears and grapes. The taste is delicate with more mixed fruits that are both sour and sweet. The palate is full and silky smooth with lively carbonation. Finishes medium in duration and dry. Overall: This has been on my wants list for a long time-Glad to finally have the chance to try it.

Best by 2014

Its a maple brown with a solid quilt of light creamy loose foam. Smells of sweetened butter, skunk and some apple skin. Flavor is sweet tea, some light tartness, some malt, some water. Thin bodied with moderate carb and a wet finish. Weird beer, it seems like it would be better less watered down.

Clear amber colour, white head. Aroma of caramel, dried apricots, candy sugar, white grape juice. Quite sweet flavour, light funk, light citrus zest, artificial sweetener. Finish dried apricot, hint of lemon zest, quite spicy. Decent beer.
(37.5cL bottle @ home)

375ml corked bottle, pours clear mahogany with a medium sized beige head that quickly dissipated. Aroma of apples, wine grapes and processed sugar. Taste is light-medium sweet, light bitter and sour. Palate is medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. An unusual lambic style of beer, relatively sweet and easy to drink. The Lambic Faro style is supposed to be sweet, but I would have liked this beer stronger and less sweet.

Bottle @ accademia della birra. Colore ambrato carico, limpida, schiuma bianco sporca poco fine, persistente. Aroma intenso, fruttato agrumato, un po di cantina, luppolo vecchio, caramello. Gusto dolce amabile, vinoso, zucchero di canna, vaniglia. Poco/nulla amara.abbastanza acida. Corposa, molto carbonata. Poco calda. Equilibrata. Abbastanza armonica, il gusto è davvero poco intenso.

Aroma of stewed fruit mixed with farmyard straw. Initial taste is sweet with dryish undertones with old & new blends creeping in. Neither one or the other and not very well blended, does it need age? Refreshing but not up to the quality of the black label Girardin.

Całkiem smaczne, ale mało lambicowe piwo. W zapachu drożdżowe, słodkawe, nuty karmelowe. W smaku pełne, ale zadziwiająco gładkie, słodkawe, wyraźnie drożdżowe, lekki karmel. Bardzo pijalne. Nie tego się spodziewałem, ale wyszło ok.

Corked 37.5 cl bottle @ home. Pours reddish brown with a tiny bit of sediment and an off-white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour is fruity, vinous, sugar, malt, and a little funk  with a slightly dry finish.
355 bottle @ home. Pours bronze with a small off white head. Aroma is funk, tart and sweets. Taste is refreshing. Quite sweet with hints of funk and orange peel.

Bottle from Muro. Thanks! Pours cloudy dark amber with thick quickly disappearing head. Aroma is lambic basement, malt, butter biscuits. Flavor is sour, lambic basement, candized sugar, malt. Quite sour for faro.

Pours copper, big off white head.

Smell licorice and sweet, almost like a lager yeast.

Taste grainy malt and a bitter funky after taste.

Mid body

Odd style

A rich malty, sweet aroma, almost sickly. Taste similar with only a very slight sourness really - tastes too sugary. An almost dank-marmite note at the end. Meh. Quite horrible actually by the end of the bottle.
0.375l bottle. Dark ruby body, no head. There is a chance that I picked a spoiled bottle, because both the aroma and taste is like cheap rum mixed with cheap cola and lemon juice.

375ml bottle. Sweet, caramel, aromas. pours dark gold to amber, quite clear, with vanishing white head, some lacing. Light to medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Taste is quite sweet, sugary, almost cloying, with very subtle tart notes. A bit dissapointing.

Bottle at Deans stickiest floor tasting. Pours a clear amber beer with a light, off white head on top. Aroma is light tart and sugary. Flavor reflects the aroma. It has a sour base and a sweetened flavor. Nicely covering the tartness. Short, sweet finish. Decent brew again. Very drinkable!
Bottle. Pours cloudy copper. Aroma is sweet, sugar and funky. Taste is medium sweet.
Bottle @ press Deans button tasting. Aroma has some caramel, touch of fruit. Flavour is slight tart red fruit some artificial sweetener.
Bottle shared at the Press Deans Button tasting. Pours clear amber with a white head. Aroma of toffee, plastercine, malt. Flavour is moderate sweet. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle shared @ JMDST.
Thin white head. Clear amber pour. A little sweet.

[bottle-aged]
Sherry-like, oxidized aroma with lots of raisins and some dark crystal characteristics that include tobacco. Hazy chestnut with an off-white ring. Sweet and sour nutty flavour that is overly sweet. Medium body, moderate carbonation, sour finish. Probably not a fair rating since the bottle was quite old.

Unken. Sötman passar inte när solen steker. Pallar absolut inte att få i mig en flaska själv. Oklart vad den här skulle pass till...
Utanför ölbutiken

A dark brown beer with a quite weak and blond head. The nose is quite sweet, lots of dark fruits, some prune, cherries and earthy sourness, nice aroma. Taste of dark fruits, quite strong sourness, nice and balanced sweetness, cellar. More sourness in the end with some biting herbs. Medium bodied, easy to drink. Quite nice, and unique beer.

The faro beers came into existence because some people couldnt handle the strong sourness of the lambiek beers. Therefore, they added sugar. So a faro will always be a sweetened version of a lambiek, in other words: inferior. No matter how great Girardin is, this beer style is just bad.

Bottle at Armins shared with friends. Pour is hazy amber brown with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Funky, dusty, sweet tart, green apple, brown sugar, bready, weird fruity, stale peel aroma. Taste is sweet and sour, somewhat funky, spicy, bready, wheaty, and caramelly with a medium sour finish. Light body with high carbonation. Ok, but a little weird.

Pour out of 375 mL bottle, big thanks to Stephen for the pour! Dark reddish pour with thin white head, aroma brought notes of funk, slight vinegar, hints of lactic, lemon, hints of earth, touch of sugary notes but not bad. Taste is a mix of slight lactic, lemon, biscuit, slight earth, grain, hints of vinegar, touch of funk. Finishing fairly tart, slightly sweet.

375 ml bottle courtesy of a trade with Boutip. Thanks, Phil. Pours a nice deep amber orange hue, darker middle, subtle haze, sunfire sunset edges and bottom. A frothy offwhite head atop dies to a filmy layer, laces smaller and sticks around loosely. Aromas are gentle oak, vanilla, subtle fruit. A touch of sweetness, faint candi sugar, grass, and mellow brett. A touch of lively carbonation on the nose. Gentle sweetness, subtle ginger beer and mellow sweetness. Touch of lactic twang, light pear apple and subtle lemon. Initial is lighter end of the fold, touch of sweetness up front, candi sugar, dough, gentle carmelization hits the palate. A touch of fizziness, apple, and gentle sweet bread. Gentle lemon, apple, and pear into the middle. Mellow funk, firmer oak, some yogurt and vanilla. A touch sticky from the sugar addition. Mellow straw, gentle sweetness, Belgian candi sugar and touch of yeast. A decent lactic yogurt element, the candi sugar covers up the sourness to a good extent. Firm oak seems to provide some synergy with candi sugar. Some banana, gentle tang, and mellow carmelized sugary feel. Firm oak, vanilla, some wet oak and firmer lactic yogurty feel. A bit of dryness, dust. Meh. Not my style, but certainly not a bad beer, mellow subtle sourness, a bit of sweetness sustains, firmer yogurty feel overall with the oak. Meh.
Dark orange/copper pour with white head. Flavor is of sweetness(feels artificial), light fruit and some mild malt sweet tones.

Pours a hazy amber with a medium white head. Aroma has some slightly sweet notes and a bit of berry..some faint tart/vomit notes creep in. Flavor is slightly sweet berries and a bit of a musty note. Mouthfeel is light and the finish is sweet...almost like sweet tea.
Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours murky dark amber with a tiny white head. Aroma of fresh berries,and tarty fruits. Taste is dry, moderate grapefruit,light acidic. Short lived end.

Flaske hos Ole Anders juni-13: lett syrligsøt aroma og lett en forfriskende letthet med snev av fjøs i smaken. Min første faro, og dette frister til gjentagelse. Både interessant og godt. Ikkee for søt og heller ikke for sur. Bare godt.

Flaska från beernavigator. Brun med drag åt rött, klar till jästfällningen följer med, lågt skum. Söt doft av honung, dadlar, farinsocker, söta äpplen med en lite geuzedoft i bakgrunden. Smaken som doften d v s söt, syran balanserar den något men det är ändå i sötaste laget. Smakbilden är dock mycket trevlig men torkad frukt och honung.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2014 Bottle from Bierkoning in Amsterdam. Fruity and slightly sour smell and taste. Berries. Easy to drink and refreshing. Re-rated after buying a second bottle. Both sweet and sour with some red berries.

Bottle @ Den tatoverede enke. Pours cloudy amber\red with a lacing off-white. Aroma is prune, light vinegar, sugar, bread, grain, apple, light herbs and funk. Taste is moderate sweet, and very light tart. Body is light, text is oily/watery/slick, carbonation is soft. Finishes light sweet .

I decided to double my faro rates so I ordered this from The George & the Dragon.  I didnt care for my first faro brew but this is much better.  Pours murky brown with musky dark fruits on nose along with that bizarre belgian sugar.  Tastes isnt too sweet which was nice surprise.  You get plenty of sugar though, figs, toffee, earth, and basement.  some bitterness on finish.  odd but thats the style
Bottle. Hazy amber with an off white head. Aroma is sweet fruit, a little tartness. Flavour is caramel and some soft fruits, raspberry. Finish is dry and a little sour.
My first experience with a Faro beer. And i must say, nice drink! It has a bit of a funky fruit flavor going on together with some candy sugar, but all well balanced and refreshing. Nice.

375mL bottle at Grote Dorst, pours a fairly clear copper golden with a medium off-white head. Aroma of candied sugar mixed with some dried funky fruits. Flavour is unlike any faro Ive had, with a sweetened version of barnyard funk without actually differentiating the sugar -- secondary flavours of leather and cardboard. Completely unique -- the sugar doesnt seem to come out separately from the other flavours, but rather just modified the base gueuze. Bizarre stuff for me, but certainly enjoyable. Not what I was expecting. Good experience.

37,5cl bottle at Bezoekerscentrum De Lambiek, Alsemberg during Tour de Geuze 2013. - Pleasantly mild and not over-sugared, delicately caramel-brown sugar-infused Faro which retains a large part of Girardin citrus funky lambiek/geuze character.

Clear orange brown with small off-white foam head, lacing. Quite sparkling.  Aroma is sour, sour apple, unripe cherry. Taste is refreshing, crisp.  (Velp 201305)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Definitely not a style Im overly found of but I try to have a few bottles stored away for non gueuze drinkers. This faro pours quite dark, It has a balanced flavour, not overly sweet and doesnt cling to our mouth like some faro beers  Ive sampled. If it is a Faro you are after this is a good example of the genre.

ottle 37,5 cl. Pours amber in color with a small off-white head. Burnt brown sugar, some sweet overripe dark fruits and burnt rubber in aroma. A bit of them sour notes in taste, burnt rubber and hints of sweetness as well in taste. Some burnt grainy notes as well in taste. Not too sweet fortunately.

375 ml bottle.
Originally rated on 20100726.
Pours hazy golden color with a small head. Aroma of sweet fruits, goose berry bush, some sugary notes and yeast. Flavor of yeast, fruits, goose berries and toffee notes.

The aroma consists of faint apple and raisin. It pours a most transparent amber with a minimal white ring for a head. The flavor starts with some light apple...somewhat cider-ish. The finish has some light sweet raisin with a hint of Belgian yeast. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.
Poured a dark amber with a thin white head. Aroma is apple and wood and sugar. Medium body, flavour is overly sweet, quite bland for a lambic.

Bottle. Pours a brown tinted amber with medium head/lacing. Aromas of apple crisp, berries, vinegar funk, and lots of sugar malts. Taste is much of the same with alot of sweet and sour notes coming through. This was interesting but Ill stick to regular lambics. Just too cloying.
Bottle. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, cellar notes, brown sugar and funk. Flavor is sweet and somewhat sour with some funk, cellar and berries. Medium body, average carbonation.

Wish this had some more sourness, or more sweetness... As it is now it is kinda doing not enough of one or the other for me. Wouldn't buy it again. Little let down because of the other girardin stuff I have had was quite something. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A steady pour into my New Belgium Globe glass produces an almost three finger thick, pale tan colored that leaves lots of lacing on the sides of my glass. The beer is a rich, slightly browned, amber color that shows a cant get any more brilliantly clear, almost metallic looking, deep red tinged, copper color when held up to the light. The aroma smells lightly tart, herbal / grassy (sort of like fresh cut nettle), woody notes that remind me quite strikingly of cedar, and a funky, sort of caramelized mushroom like, musty, and slightly musky character. Softer, more subtle notes of nutty malt oxidation, apple like fruitiness.

Nicely effervescent, even prickly, but not nearly as sweet as that Strubbe beer I just had, but there is a touch of sweetness here. The nettle like, sort of cedar leaning character from the nose is lightly here in the flavor. Nicely tart, with a lactic leaning sourness. A touch of nutty character barely sneaks through, and the oxidation also seems to have something to do with the cedar like notes here. The body is light enough that this is quite drinkable; it has a light touch of body to it, without really clinging to the palate at all.

The cedar and nettle notes are quite interesting here; it is interesting how distinct they are. This doesnt seem as sweet as many a Faro, is that b/c I have had this for a couple years, or is it just that the last beer I had was quite a bit too sweet. Regardless, this is actually better, and more enjoyable than I was expecting.

375ml bottle. Slightly cloudy amber colour with small, frothy to creamy, minimally lacing, off-white head. Fruity tart aroma has notes of apple, apple parings, dark berries, grapes, vinegar. Taste is initially tart, notes of vinegar, balsamico, dry overtones of fruit parings, later with spicy notes of bouillon, lovage; constant low level sweetness.

Ambrata tendente al bruno con un cappello di schiuma mediamente persistente. Laroma è quanto mai simile a quello del prosciutto cotto con qualche lieve nota acida e una retrolfattivita di zucchero di canna. Al palato mi ha stupito per la lieve acidità (che era gia stata anticipata nellaroma) contrastata dalla presenza del caramello e dello zucchero di canna. Riscaldandosi riemerge di nuovo quel qualcosa di prosciutto cotto. Alla lunga stucchevole, cè da dire però, che è facile da bere.

Kaatuu Girardinin omaan lasiin Kolanvärisenä ja niukkavaahtoisena. Haju on hyvin hapan, mutta todella makea, josta huomaa ns. lisätyn sokerin. Maku makean marjainen ja makea. Lambicmaiseen tyyliin myös hyvin hapan. Suutuntuma sokerisen makea, mutta melko katoava. Kaiken kaikkiaan mukava ja raikas lambic, josta jäi hyvä muisto.

Bottle: The aroma consists of faint apple and raisin. It pours a most transparent amber with a minimal white ring for a head. The flavor starts with some light apple...somewhat cider-ish. The finish has some light sweet raisin with a hint of Belgian yeast. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2013 
37,5 cl bottle @ hotel room, Brussels. Rated on 19.07.2010
Aroma has sugar, syrupy notes and some fruits. Flavour is very sweet and syrupy with lots of sugar, some fruits and hints of hay. Too sweet.

pours brown, clear, way darker than expected. smell has hints of sour. not intense
white head fades , taste is very off. dryness, hints of sourness withoud being sour. tastes like something that is to old ( yet i did like a straffe winter, 5 years old ! )  . very dry, hard to drink,... not something iod drink again. ever.

Bottle. Light brown dark amber. Nose has cane sugar, cola, murky yeast. Body is quite unfizzy, flat, has the cork leaked? Cola, malts, murky yeast. Theres definitely the faro character, but the bottle may be bad. Almost flat, murky.-- bb/h

330ml bottle - a dark red body with a thin white froth. Not a lot in the nose, a bit of yeast and sugar, a bit of strawberry, other than that not a lot. The taste is strawberry jam, a bit tart, a little cane sugar. The after taste is lasting, with a bit of dryness. A little syrupy but pleasant enough body. Okay I guess.
Bottle. Pours dark red with a off white head. Bakers yeast, sugar and something a bit berry in the aroma. Very sweet and light tasting. A bit berry in taste aswell.

Bottle from Ölbutikken.
Sugary sweet with some fruityness. Odd mix of bitterness, sweetness and tartness. Quite light.

37.5cl bottle from Geers
Ambrée/cuivrée, col fin beige.
Arôme sur des notes sucrées, caramel avec un léger malté et houblonnage à cru fleuri et citronné très léger.
Palais est assez bizarre, entre aigreur et une sorte de soupe de vieux légumes; asperge bouillies. Le tout est sec avec une fine note de caramel et sucre et toujours ce côté renfermé qui se termine sur une aigreur de lambic. De loin une de mes moins préférées des Faro surtout au niveau de ce profile légumes trop prenant/levure.

Bottle a home (Noel Cuvelier) - 21/10/12.
Dark amber with a big frothy white head, which does begin to thin after a minute or so.
Smells of sweet caramelised sugars, toffee apple, figs, lightly burnt brown sugar and ripe fruits.
Sweet toffee flavour, dark fruits in the background, sweet sugar, apples, prunes, light sour tones, a little earthy.
Medium bodied with fine carbonation leading to a sweet finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
25/VIII/2012 37.5cl bottle from Dranken Geers (Oostakker) @ my parents in laws place - BB: 2031 (2012-964) 
Clear amber to copper red beer, big aery off-white head, pretty stable, little adhesive. Aroma: cheesy, lemon, some vinegar, bretta, bit picy, stinky feet. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, caramel, lemony, bit sour, lambic. Aftertaste: caramel, sugary, bretta, lemony, little bitter.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Colour is clear light brown with a big white foam head. Nose is fragrant woody, ale fruity, musty, caramel, sour yeasty. Taste is ale fruity, caramel, orange citrous, brown sugar, Brett yeasty, with an ever so slight sour note. Overall its sweet, caramel, sugary, musty.

Bottle shared by esp0r, thanks mate!
Hazy dark golden color, big white head. Sugary aroma with acids, lemon, hay. Sweet taste, lots of sugar, caramel, cinnamon, oak, brett. Low carbonation, sweet and dry finish at the same time, lasting aftertaste of sweet grapefruit.

375ml bottle. Clear, can-see-through, brown liquid with small dirty head. Nose : notes of citrus fruits and vinegar, some wood aromas. Bread. Cherry fruits. Sip : decent carbonation, low density with a bit thicker texture. Sweet and sour like lemon or grapefruit juice with zest bite. Bitterness is really well balanced into this brew. Fruity aromas now includes apple flavors. Some spices like clove and cinnamon. Overall I enjoy the existing bitterness in it. Im not a big fan of lambic but this one isnt bad at all .

Bottle (bought at Ølbutikken in 2010)

Slightly hazy copper with a small head. Soft aroma with yeast, sugar, fruit and with a light sourness. The sweet taste was a bit more sour but nothing extreme. Some vinegar, citrus and notes och spices. Descent stuff.

Bottle bought at Ølbutikken summer 2011 shared with Daje one year after
Copper hazy, white head. Smells of barnyard, brett, and hints of gastric acid. The cork smelled awful, not ratet. Taste is heavy sweet, because of the actual sugar added. It eats up most of the acids in this beer, still there is some lactic acids hidden back. (ruled of the sugar). Some brett funky characters also in the flavor. This beer shows all i love about rating and beer. Brett character without the beer being sour, strange aromas that i cant find in the flavor... i just love it

Pours cloudy amber with a tiny white head. Aroma has sweeter sugary notes, sweet fruits (apples&plums) and a bit of belgian yeasty sweetness. Taste of sugary plums, weak caramel, low amount of tartness, hints of berries and some spices. A bit one sided but not bad at all.

Orangebrun med ett smutsvitt livligt skum som lämnar skumgardiner. Doftar inte så kraftigt. Doft av jäst, jäst frukt och en lätt surhet. Smaken har både klassiska ölkomponenter som sötma och citrusbeska tillsammans med en lätt Lambic-surhet. Min första Faro. Angenäm bekantskap.

Little head, brown. Nose with soft caramel, bread, fritcake and a little sourness in the back. Nice! Medium body and length. Taste is a light sour caral´mel with some apricot, orange and  raspberry? Also fruitcake. Me like!

Delad med NordicV (tack). Orangebrun öl med ett fluffigt skum som aldrig riktigt vill sjunka ihop. Doftar av stall, vinäger, citrus, kanske aningen av honung. Smaken är precis lagom sur och smakar ungefär som den doftar. En riktigt trevlig Lambic.

Pours dark,dirty amber with a small tan head.
Scent is barnyard, must, vinegar and tart yeast.....striking.
Taste is initial tart blast that mellows to a soft mild spice and light hops.
very good overall.
Bottle. Sweet/tart fruity, musty yeasty aroma. Amber with a small white head. Mildly sweet/tart fruit, musty flavor with a light spiciness in the finish. Light carbonated body, smooth dry finish.

Amber with white head. Weak aroma with belgium, yeast and sweetness in it. Its a one dimensional lambik with very little vinegar to it.. Havent had any other faros so far though. The sweetness in this beer reveals the classic beer-characteristics. I find muscatel in this as well. Not very exciting, but still good tasting.

Bottle popped on the top floor of Hotel Mirabeau in Brussels

Pours an amber color with a medium loose head and some lacing on the glass.

The aroma is vinous, woody, brandy-like, generally weird... kind of off-putting. 

The flavor is like some sort of sour cola, some nice clean tartness is in there, some caramel. some sweet and sour candy. 

Immediately rejected by my wife who noted that she was both sick of Faro & not terribly keen on the overall character of this one, I was left with the whole bottle. Im glad for this though, because as I drank this its charm started to show more and more, it became a fairly enjoyable beverage towards the end of the bottle.

Bottle, pours copper with medium head. Aroma is horseblanket. overipe fruits, funk and some citrus. Taste is like aroma, sweet and sour, tart. Cant really say why but this didnt suit me that much. But still ok.

Bouteille 375ml, courtoisie de SlovakSniper. De couleur cuivrée-orange foncée et claire. Nez de levures fruitées aux petites notes sûres (léger de citron, traces de canneberges, de cerises sûres et de pommes vertes), légèrement boisé (bois humide) et floral avec des notes de beurre et de pain sucré. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement bas-moyen et une texture aux notes huileuses / sirupeuses. Goût fruité sucré, légèrement acide et aux faibles notes sûres (notes de cerises sûres et de pommes, traces de citron) accompagné dun léger goût de bois humide lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un léger goût de pain mouillé avec des notes de sirop de fruits et quelques traces de beurre puis en finale lon retrouve un léger goût herbeux (herbes mouillées) avec quelques notes florales. Post-goût moyen et aux notes sèches, très faiblement aigres de fruits (moût de petits fruits).

375mL caged and corked dark green bottle pours metallic looking copper brown with tiny off white head. The aroma offers up some odd notes like cherry covered buttered German rye bread, dank wood notes, some dank woody basement grainy malts and the odd berry fruit or two floating over the top. The flavor delivers rings of berry and near cherry like fruitiness with modest tartness and basement woody dankness at the middle. It stays that way and then lingers into the finish with a decent amount of berry notes, tartness, odd yeasty notes and a touch of dryness.

Bottle 37,5 cl, Ölkonsortiet, shared with Lotta. Pours clear deep dark copper amber with a great fluffy beige pinkish head leaving lace. Aroma is sweet, berry, fruity, sour, dark syrup and yet dry. Flavor is sour sweet fruity in frotn, bitter pungent tart and has nice sweetness from middle to the end. Finishes dry tart and a bit pungent.
Flaske: Orangebrun øl med et fint tyndt skumhoved. Duft af rørsukker og en smule hestedækken. Smagen er forholdsvis sur, men med en stor sødme fra rørsukker. Meget drikbar øl

Jan 2010: Cork and caged 0.375 litre bottle.

Faros can be really sweet or really sour, this one leans towards the sour end, but has a sweetness to it also.

Murky brown to reddish in colour, small off-white head which left some limp lacing on the glass.

The small was rather off-putting, an aroma of bile and sour sick hit my nose, not nice.

The tastebuds took a hammering here, initially sweet, it swiftly reversed into a sour vinegar, cooking apple, scrumpy cider sort of taste. Strange how it changed so quickly into a homebrewed cider sort of beer.

I found it difficult to finish and that is rare with me, so not the best Faro Ive had.

375ml bottle. Copper shade and a decent amount of head. Nose is lemony with some of the sugar coming through. There are sour sensations at the start and finish of a sip, but its a very restrained sourness. In between the beer opens itself up, with a decent honey, lemon and caramel type character. Not a great deal of complexity though. This beer, my first faro, may not have been overly exciting, but Im glad to have been introduced to the style.
Ricordo di averlo fatto assaggiare ad un caro amico, che testualmente mi ha detto ma che cosa è sta roba...
Bottle. Cloudy orange gold, foamy head. Barnyard funk, wood, dark fruit, sour grapes and apple, citrus, cranberry. Balanced for a Faro.

Pours sort of a murky amber color with a small off-white head.  As anticipated, very sweet.  Quite fruity with an interesting butterscotch note to it as well.  Decently funky with some must, oak, and straw.  Lightly tart with a lemon/lactic note.  The flavor has the same interesting combination of sweetness and tartness.  A bit of citrus peel along with candy, sugar, and butterscotch.
UPDATED: JUL 10, 2013 A good balance between sourness and sweetness. But there is a strange metalic taste in this faro.

37,5 cl. bottle into a flute. Clear reddish amber colour  with a big and fluffy head of beige foam. The aroma shows notes of musty, fermenting figs and other dark fruits, caramel sweetness and mildly funky, oak tartness. Taste is sweet and tart, caramelized figs and fruits complimented by notes of apple cider and something earthy. Light to medium bodied with a thin texture. Lively carbonated. This is my first faro, and I did not have high hopes, this one however turned out nicely.

08/06/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (handpump). Ambrata con pochissima schiuma, quasi del tutto assente. Al naso un indecifrabile aroma di lieviti selvatici, con sentori di stalla e formaggio, e zucchero di canna. In bocca è un minestrone ancor meno decifrabile, eccessivamente zuccheroso per i miei gusti, lacido non emerge. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Mettiamola così, non sono un fan di questo genere di birra.

Brown-colored beer with small foam. I should not it be allowed to rate such a beer, since I have not learned to value this beer but ... Nasty tastes, smells horribly of stale beer. Sour beer and so anyway with a sweet finnish.

#1262 bruges festival 2012; nose is decent grape, little hay, barnyard, red apple zest, cranberry whiff, feel is watery, carb is medium, taste is sour grapes, lime, citrus note, some red apple acid, then weak brett and cloves

375 ml bottle @ home  purchased @ Streekproductencentrum in Halle: (A) pure amber, you can see the tiny bubbles rising in your glass with a firm lambic-style head resting on top  (S) very sweet caramel drenched mustiness with some barnyard funk buried underneath  (T) a very weird concoction of cellar mustiness & cobwebs with oodles of slightly burned caramel (lots & lots of it), brown sugar, some syrup with a small hint of honey, finish goes into a weird combination of burned caramel & utterly bizarre bitter artificial sweetener  (B) oily, syrupy, well-carbonated, what a bizarre mad scientist brew

Pour is a deep copper color with tons of a tight bubbly tan head.  The nose is light, mostly lambic, a little cob web like fun and some faint caramel and brown sugar.  Taste follows the nose but a slight bit sweeter.  Cobweb and dusty funk adds a bit of complexity as sweet caramel and brown sugars come in.  The body is light with a very active feel on the tongue and a hint of dryness.  The flavors and nose are a bit muted but it does offer balance and some depth of flavors.

27-JAN-2012, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
Almost clear amber with beige head.
Dusty fruity nose. Taste is very malty fruity with red and dark fruit. Some yeasty notes and a hing of brett. A little tart and ends sweet. Carbonation like a Coca Cola...
A bit too simple but OK.

chocolate, cereal, grass, cheese, dough, leather, raisin, cooked vegetables, amber, hazy, minimal head, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, average carbonation, thin feel, astringent,

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 2011 bottle opened 1/7/2012
A: Dark caramel colored body.  Crystal clear with a pale khaki one-inch cap.  A few stray steaks left on the sides of the glass.

S: Caramel, apples, oak, and brown sugar.  A nice general funky/musty character.

T: Like the nose, the Girardin Faro is dominated by caramel, apples, oak and must.  The one draw back is that you can tell that there is artificial sweetener here (Ace-K).

M: Medium bodied.  Gentle carbonation.  Nice tartness.  However, the presence of Ace-K creates a chemically residual sweetness that isnt present in fresh faro.

O: A decent bottled offering of faro.  Id prefer Girardin cut the crap and remove the AceK though.

Clear light brown pour with a thin white head. Bready caramel and acetic dark fruits lead to a curious Flemish Red like profile, finishing with sweet funky nectar, lemon juice, and white grape. Medium body with low carbonation and a puckery sweet finish. Yummy!

Bouteille de 37,5cl. Bière ambrée avec une mousse beige qui ma surpris dêtre aussi durable. Une fine couche avait persisté jusquà la fin. Le nez est léger, boisé, une touche de cassonade est perceptible. Peu de levure sauvages sont accessibles. La bouche est peu complexe, facile, soyeuse. Il y a un léger suret en fin de bouche qui résiste.

375 ml corked anbd caged bottle shared by adneilsen (thanks AAron) poured a hazy orange amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of barnyard, carmel, citrus, tobacco and cedar. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of carmel, cinnbamon, apple and light barnyard with a smooth dry lingering spiced finish.

Bottle @ ratmans house, courtesy of wavers1. Somewhat cloudy, slightly reddish orange appearance with a white head. Somewhat funky, barnyard, tart citrus fruity, dark sugar aroma. Tart, plum, apple, somewhat spicy, dark sugar, tangy citrusy, slightly tart flavor. Pretty cool brew.

Bottle shared by adnielsen.  Pours hazy amber with a medium, fizzy white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is fruity, biscuit malt, lactic, apples, and horse blanket.  Flavor is malt, horse blanket, plums, light sourness, and a dry finish.  Light body, low warmth with medium carbonation.

Bottle:
Vast small off white head on top of an almost clear dark orange colered beer.
Smell wood, yeast, light sour, some sweets like sticky brown sugars, fruit like dried peach, dried prunes and dried figs.
Taste is a nice mix of sweet and sour with spices, yeast, wood, malts, caramel, some fruit and a nasty bitterness.
Nasty bitter malty sweet yeasty aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft light dryish light tingly ish mouthfeel, good medium body (tents towards a lightly higher one) and a light watery texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Wisps of brown sugar on the nose with traces of acidity.  Pours a reddish amber with a solid white head.  Mild acidity upfront with some brown sugar notes.  Not overly sweet but not very acidic either.  Finishes very dry.  Nice.
Brownish reddish colour, well carbonated with a weak head. Subtly fruity sour smell. Flat alcoholic taste with a light bitter sourness. Quite watery. Dry finish.

Bottle @ home, shared with Thompson. Light amber / dark copper color, thin white lacing on top. Smell malts and lots of grains. Tastes grainy and lightly sour. Pretty boring. Low to medium carbonation, low body.

37.5 cL bottle from ABS Drinks in Winksele poured into a Westvleteren glass at home.  Foamy head over a fizzy amber beer.  Smells sweet and of acetic acid.  Dry, bitter finish, not as sour as I was expecting - the taste is a little underwhelming but fine.  Reasonable.

bottle... bright light copper, light watery head... the aroma is almost dead, barley, sweet, sweaty socks, needs more umphf... easy to drink but boring, sugary water with a faint sour tickle on the finish, a bit of hay... average
Bottle. Poured sunburst with a foamy off white head. Barnyard smells, hay. Sweet, not sour. Citrus, wood.

(37.5 cl)  Une mince couche de mousse flotte sur un liquide orangé.  Au nez, des notes douces se choquent à des parfums boisés et floraux avec quelques microbes et une petite touche de beurre.  Les saveurs acides et surettes sont rapidement contenues par le sucre.  Des fruits semblent se définir : serait-ce la pomme?  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen avec un pétillement bas et une texture légèrement huileuse.  La finale se fait sur des notes aigres-douces plus ou moins intenses.

Tap at The Wedding. Kind of weird overall but somewhat refreshing. Very sweet, not too sour. Mildly tangy. Sugary. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Sweet finish. Reminded me of iced tea. So so.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2013 Bottle from de Bier Tempel. Pours a nice golden brown colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of pickled onions / malt vinegar with a little horse-blanket, hay, lemon and earth. Light candy sweetness but not as extreme as other Faros Ive had. Similar flavours, not overly sour, with a nice musty, earthy flavour. Quite refreshing. One of my favourites of the style.
sour milk aroma,brown golden, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice soft and light sour finish.

Nice to try a desent Faro. a bit sour, floral, caramel and citrus smell.
The lambic comes trou the flavor. So you have a touch of Geuze, but not complete though

Clear copper-red topped by a generous thick head. Light aromas of wood, red wine, slight acidity coming trough the nose (acetic?) with a complex fruity bouquet of black cherries. Light to medium body, creamy, light sourness, a touch of sweetness to balance everything and a lingering woody finish, just a bit too astringent. Very nice introduction to lambics.

(bottle) pours a clear dark copper colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of butter, old cheese and canned tomatos, excessively vegetal. flavour is total diacetyl, sugar and boiled vegetables, couldnt drink more than two sips. medium-bodied with average carbonation. drain-pour.
Bottle, pours a nice golden hazy colour, the taste is very smooth with a bit of dryness and a hint of souriness at the back, very nice offering, good example of the style
Bottle purchased in Brussels. Poured light orange/brown with little head that retained. Mostly yeasty flavours with medium body and smooth, slightly sour finish.

37,5cl bottle (2010) via a trade with bu11zeye. Faro rating number 10. Pours with a pretty much clear (yeast compacted to the bottom of the bottle) golden to nearly a light copper hued body with a medium large off-white head. Big bubbles, head slowly fades leaving surprisingly good lacing. Aromas are floral and funky with a decent amount of a spicy wood note (a bit cedar like). Funky, earthy, light peppery phenolic. Why cant pseudo/backsweetened lambics smell more like this? Lightly lemony, medium sugar notes, tobacco. Flavors are interesting. Strike a pretty interesting balance between sweet and sour. Overall finishing a bit sour. Much less sugary tasting than some of the other authentic Faros that I have tried (Boon comes to mind). Pretty enjoyable, and makes me rethink the Bruerys Pharaoh (as far as it not showing enough sugar character). A good amount of funk which I love from both of Girardins 1882 Gueuzes. Horseblanket, tobacco, grassy, earthy, straw, lemon, sandalwood, humidor. Pretty complex, but missing overall on the acidity. An interesting bitter nearly tannic note on the finish (wood tannin possibly). Quite lively on the palate with playful carbonation. Fuller bodied and not quite as dry as a gueuze, but still decently dry and medium to light bodied. No visible alcohol. Overall, one of the better real Faros that I have had the opportunity to try thus far (definitely the best bottled one). Enjoyable funk with only enough sweetness to challenge the sourness. Nice!

0.33l bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen shared with ClubGonzo and the rest of Bergen Tasting Crew. Pours a cloudy dark orange body with a thin sidesticking filmy white head. Aroma has tart and sour green apples, sour cherries, light sugary, strong barnyard, notes of wood and some hints of rhubarb-vinegar. Oily to sticky mouthfeel, soft carbonation and medium-bodied. Tastes quite a lot sweeter than I would have thought. Nicely balanced though. Notes of vinegar, sugar, lime perhaps? And some hints of cherries towards the ending. Ends light kinda watery with notes red currants and gooseberries. Interesting stuff indeed!

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen, shared with Palme and friends. Pours a hazy deep orange body with a small white head. Aroma is citric barnyard funk, lemon peel, hints of molasses, wood and traces of cherry. Nice. Taste is sweet/sour funky brett tones, toffee and molasses with hints of burnt rubber tones well hidden in the back towards the end of the palate. Smooth and very drinkable. A nice and well-balanced Faro, as far as Im concerned.

A mid orange-yellow with all the right signs of being a good drink. Disappointing on the taste as the sweetness seems out of place, though this is what the style should be like. A bit thicker than single lambics due to the candy sugar and the sour character is still present beneath the sweetness. Will stick to gueuzes in the future i think!

Bottle. Copper  pour.  Citrus and tart aroma. 

Somewhat sweet artificial taste that finishes tart.
Bottle a amber colored beer with a white head aroma sourness fruit lemon caramel and oak flavor sourness dry fruits lemon and apples sugar caramel and oak

Solid cream head, no lacing. Sugar, earth, moss, and a little bit of syrup in the nose. Flavor of burnt caramel, citrus, clinging sugar on the teeth, and a little mint. No wild elements here, but it seems more coherent that way, only the slightest bit of citric acid to remind this has lambic in it.
Keg at MesandSims wedding. Nice. Pomegranate. Nice - dry, thin, refreshing, tannin. Enjoyable without being expansive or overwhelming.
Bottle @ DØE meeting. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of caramel, white sugar, cherries, barn. Taste is tart apples, cherries, oak, barn, hay, sugar. thin body, soft carbonation. 170310

Tap at MesandSims crazy wedding party! It pours clear amber, with a massive foamy white head and soft carbonation. The nose is white sugar, caramel, egg and farmyard. The taste is white sugar, sweet pear, apple, ice tea, sweet cherry, hay, grass and light spice, with hay in the finish. Not for me. As faros go this is probably a good one.

Tasted on 6/22/11 from a 375mL bottle sent to me in a trade, thanks to Boutip.  Pours hazy dark orange-amber with a thick and rocky off-white head that slowly recedes to an even layer of lace.  The nose is pretty classic lambic with sour lemon, earthy barnyard funk, and some vanilla and cinnamon from the oak treatment, but there is an added caramel note that I have never gotten from a classic lambic before.  The flavor is still pretty sour with the lemon pith coming through, along with just a hint of the light barnyard funk and oak treatment with the sugar providing more weight on the mouth feel than actual sweetness.  The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long sour lemon and caramel finish.
tap at mesandsim wedding ... soft sweet fruits... light toffee nose... tart sout front ... sweet sugery linger ... oh no.... take it away

tap at bier circus.  aroma of sweet candied sugar apples, perfume, dirty doughy balsamic.  dirty rust pour with a small film of big foamy bubbles.  okay.  weird perfume and tangy dark candied fruits witha   touch of lactic sourness.

Dezent säuerlicher Herbeantrunk. Dass dies ein Faro ist merkt man zwar, die Süße wirkt aber nicht künstlich, die Säuerlichkeit kann sich, wenn auch nur mild, im Vordergrund halten. Ausgewogen, sehr süffig, minmal holzig. Ein guter weil sanfter Einstieg in die Geuzewelt! 9/11/12/9/9/11

37.5 oz bottle with cork stopper. Clear reddish ravdarvet pour with a small white head of short duration. Aroma of slightly bitter berries, light caramel and dried fruit. The taste is sweet and sour at the same time and slightly bitter towards weak lime or grapefruit. Relatively short aftertaste

37,5cl bottle. Pours amber/light brown with a big eggshell colores head. Long lasting foam and good lacing. Aroma is mostly sweet with  a tart presence. Definite Girardin-funk and some ethanol hints. Taste is on the same line: funk and ethanol notes, some sweetness and tartness. Not very acidic. Quite dry finish. Boy is medium and carbonation is high. Overall a nice brew made very pleasant by the typical Girardin funk. Not as easily drinkable as standard gueuze though.
Shared bottle courtesy of tarjei. Clear amber with a white film. Berries, caramel, light dried fruits and dried figs. Sweet, acidic and grapefruit bitter flavour. Dry. Medium body. Short finish.

Thanks to Craig.  Mostly clear reddish amber with a small off-white head leaving foam and bubbles.  Aroma is funky with a sugary sweetness and something a bit unpleasant.   Caramel malt base with mild tartness balanced by sweet sugar.  Earthy and funky.  Medium-light body with softer carbonation and good mild acidity.  Decent stuff, not bad for the style.
Flaska på Basunen 2011: Trevlig, len ekdoft. Frisk, mycket sök - förfriskande och helt utan strevhet. Kanske en aning för söt, men det är ju en Faro

Bottle 375ml @ home
Pours clear brown with a off-white head. Aroma is sweet and sour at the same time. Taste is medium sour, and light sweet. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is fizzy

375ml corked and caged, thanks Tom!  Clear bright light amber with tight white head.  Sweet bright sugar, light musty wool, hints of lemon and old stale oak.  Sweet candied sugar, dank and musty wet wool, lemon...pretty much like the nose.  I am not Faro aficionado, but this is pretty good and has more of a lambic character than the others I have had in the style.

bottle at restobieres--pours copper big rocky white head. nose is peachy. taste is light, round, fizzy, a bit more sweet than I was expecting, almost cloying. a little bit sweet in the finish. much more pronounced after eating escargot.

Clear reddish brown with a big beige head. Aroma is sweet, caramel and moderate sour - vinegar. Flavor is medium sweet and light sour. Light acidic and dry finish. A bit light bodied and somewhat watery. Too high carbonation. 250311
Color is dark red, Foam disappears down to 2 mm. Aroma is some peach, brown sugar and barnyard. Taste is some sourness, sugar and dark riped fruits, with peach.

Bottle from Bier Tempel, Brugge. Comes in a mini champagne like bottle. Pungent sour fruity yeasty aroma. Clear medium brown colour with a good head. Strange bitter fruity flavour with coffee caramel aftertaste. A bit like dry vimto. Not really my thing.

2/21/11.  Bottle thanks to jtclockwork.  Clear orange pour with a small white head. Funky aroma with a hint of smoke, burnt caramel, and sweet sugars.  Sweet, slightly sour flavor with a touch of smoke, oak, and brown sugar/caramel.

head: thin, creamy , white 
colour: caramel , orangy , amber 
smell: apples, caramel, wineousy nose, some mild soury touch, overall sweet , but ver enjoyable !! , reminds me a bit of a barley wine 
taste: start is cooked vegetables, skunky , salty malts in the start, a bit champagne like yeastnotes, end is more of a dry , nuty malty flavour , no real sourness in the beer ... kind of a dissapointment , but still a good beer i think ...

Pours orange with a small head that instantly disappears. Only faint signs of spontaneous fermentation in this one, with some slight tartness and a funky hint. Not much sweetness either, but a rather dry beer.

Bottle 375ml. Pours a clear, dark amber with lasting offwhite head. Aroma is basement, sugar, earth, autum leaves, Taste is light to medium sweet, later light to medium sour. Medium body, thin, average carbonation. Lasting sour, watery feel.
Bottle shared with drowland. Pours clear amber brown. Nose is strong. Lots of funk, brown sugar, candi sugar and peat. Taste is burnt wood, dry sherry and funk.

375 ml bottle. Finland.
Clear brown colour with small off-white head.
Sour fruity aroma with some sweetness and hints of mint (?). 
Flavour is mild sourness and some sugar sweetness. Slowly sourness is overruled by sugar. Short aftertaste.

Hazy light brown coloured. Average carbonation and a medium off-white head. Sweet grainy hinted aroma with some slight herby hints. Medium sprankling body. Finish is sour sweet, fruity and suggary hinted. Nicely balanced. Very good faro.

375 ml bottle; thanks to grownfool for the trade; pours clear light brown the thin, creamy white head lingering; dense brown on the glass; a little poopy lemon on the nose with dry oak, a little generic berry; drinks with some lift sugar, tart lemon, orange and plenty of oak; the oak flavors remind me a little bit of the jolly pumpkin reserve series beers; very light, creamy sugars and oak dry finish; a touch of vinegar, but otherwise I dig it; very low level of poopy sourness, dusty malt, lots of oak
Bottle.My first faro.Clear amber colour with no head.Aroma sweet and flowery with taste of berries and rosewine nice refreshing with dry and sweet finish.

Bottle thanks to Papsoe, Pours a medium brown with red highlights near the side of the glass. Decent half inch cream coloured head. Good lacing. Earthy musky aromas with some candi sugar sweetness. Bllody good stuff. Flavours come as a bit of a surprise. No where near as sweet as other faros i have had. A little sweetness and some sourness give way to a slightly earthy dry finish. Mouthfeel fads away somewhat also. Carbonation is initially quite lively but once again seems to fade away at the finish. Really enjoy this one.
Red brown coloured beer with small white head and no carbonation. A malty sweet aroma. Full slight sparkling palate. Finish is bitter hopped ending dry sweet.
brown coloured body with a little off white head a sweet fruity malty sugar aroma a sweet malty fruity sugar  little soury taste with a soury bitter finish

Bottle. Pours a murky amber color with a slight white head. The aroma is more funky than expected and has a slight herbal, medicinal note. The taste is quite a surprise and reminds me of sweet peppermint. The medicinal notes in the nose are slightly present in the taste but not as much, I think they get covered up by the sweetness of the malt. Very easy drinking with a light/medium mouthfeel. Some notes of cedar or wood as well.

Bottle courtesy of dkachur on 04/17/2010 at the 11th Richmond RateBeer Gathering. Clear copper body with a small frothy off-white head. Sweet caramel and faint tart aroma. Sweet caramel, light fruit hints with some slight tart notes. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

(Tap @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated @ 7.8.2010.)
Clear amber colour without a head. Loads of brown sugar, syrup and raisin on the aroma. The taste is very much like a cough drop with brown sugar. The palate is light bodied with a sweet and a bit dry finish. A decent faro.

Tart poopy nose, much less sweet than the other Faro I tried, this is more my style.  Hazy orange gold, sticky white lacing.  Tart lemon is abruptly replaced with a liquid sugar until only sweet lemon remains.  The sweetness covers up the complexity Ive grown to love from the standard gueuze.

Dusty musty skunky light wheaty, lightly funky nose with hints sugars. Pours hazy orange lasting thin head. Tart funky poopy somewhat dusty and skunky with soft sweet sugars there. Mildly tart and funky and enjoyable.

375, corked and baled. Thanks clint. Pours a cloudy dark brown with golden brown edges. Loose slim tan rim. Big funky nose, lots of raw barnyard showing. Creamy medium body with soft carb. Sweet candi sugar on the mid palate. Sweet refreshing and delicious.

Bottle at some eatery in Brussels with a bunch of Danes. Pours a cloudy brown color with a small white head. The aroma is sweet prunes and sugar. The flavor is a very sweet brown ale with light lambic sourness. Enjoyable. Earthy.

Almost copper pour with light head and lace. A hint of brown sugar and belgian yeast and some spice. Sweet brown sugar flavor, sour and tart finish with a very sharp finish. Medium bodied with nice aggressive carbonation. An almost cherry flavor.

From barrel at Bier Circus.
Appearance : Deep clear amber with no head.

Aroma : Woody with brown sugar. Rather subtle. 

Taste : Woody, light acidic, moderate sweetness. Some brown sugar. Light notes of exotic fruits. Lingering sugars on the finish

Overall : Quite interesting one. Nose is a bit boring but taste is interesting. The exotic fruits notes were similar to what I get in some ice ciders. The sweetness attenuates the strong woody presence of the lambic. Quite enjoyable.

Pours a cloudy light cherry red with a white head.
The aroma is fruity, funky and sour.The flavor is lightly sweetened fruit delivered on what I felt to be a watery palate.
Reminded me of a thin Lindemanns.
Bottled 375ml. Good head retention. Raisin, vinegar, wood, christmas pudding and apples in the nose. I didnt really enjoy this beer. Dissapointing.

7th March 2010. Clear dark amber beer. No head whatsoever. Zero carbonation. Dry palate. Some sourness comes through before sweet coca cola kicks in. A little repressed worcester sauce. Finishes airy and dry.
